text: Lydeke von Dülmen Krumpelmann (born Groningen, 24 August 1952) is a Dutch sculptor and ceramist.Biographical data at the Netherlands Institute for Art History Von Dulmen, daughter of the artist Erasmus Herman von Dülmen Krumpelmann and illustrator Marieke Eisma, has started working as a ceramist in 1972. She made the prizes for the Northern International Concours hippique Zuidlaren, and the gift to the parting of the King's Commissioner in the province of Drenthe Tineke Schilthuis and Ad Oele in 1982 and 1989.Encyclopedia Drenthe Online The work of von Dülmen is particularly inspired by the world of the animal. She is a member of the Drenthe Painting Association, established by her father Erasmus Herman and grandfather Erasmus Bernhard Dulmen Krumpelmann. == See also == * List of Dutch sculptors * List of Dutch ceramists == References == Category:Dutch ceramists Category:Dutch sculptors Category:Dutch women ceramists Category:Dutch women sculptors Category:People from Groningen (city) Category:1952 births Category:Living people
title: Lydeke von Dülmen Krumpelmann
